results.title: The influence of statins on the risk of post-stroke epilepsy.
results.text_hl: @<m>DISEASE_Epilepsy_Post_Traumatic</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D004834 @@@PSE@@@ was significantly more prevalent among those who did not receive statins and those with lower doses of @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@.

citations.NLM: Vitturi BK, Gagliardi RJ. The influence of statins on the risk of post-stroke epilepsy. Neurol Sci. 2020 Jul;41(7):1851-1857. PMID: 32086686
citations.BibTeX: @article{32086686, title={The influence of statins on the risk of post-stroke epilepsy.}, author={Vitturi BK and Gagliardi RJ}, journal={Neurol Sci}, volume={41}, number={7}, pages={1851-1857}}

results.title: Simvastatin Treatment in Traumatic Brain Injury: Operation Brain Trauma Therapy.
results.text_hl: Results indicated an intermediate beneficial effect of @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ on motor performance on the gridwalk (FPI), balance beam (@<m>DISEASE_Epilepsy_Post_Traumatic</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D004834 @@@CCI@@@), and rotarod tasks (@DISEASE_Head_Injuries_Penetrating @DISEASE_MESH:D020197 @@@PBBI@@@).

citations.NLM: Mountney A, Bramlett HM, Dixon CE, Mondello S, Dietrich WD, Wang KK, Caudle K, Empey PE, Poloyac SM, Hayes RL, Povlishock JT, Tortella FC, Kochanek PM, Shear DA. Simvastatin Treatment in Traumatic Brain Injury: Operation Brain Trauma Therapy. J Neurotrauma. 2016 Mar 15;33(6):567-80. PMID: 26541177
citations.BibTeX: @article{26541177, title={Simvastatin Treatment in Traumatic Brain Injury: Operation Brain Trauma Therapy.}, author={Mountney A and Bramlett HM and Dixon CE and Mondello S and Dietrich WD and Wang KK and Caudle K and Empey PE and Poloyac SM and Hayes RL and Povlishock JT and Tortella FC and Kochanek PM and Shear DA}, journal={J Neurotrauma}, volume={33}, number={6}, pages={567-80}}

results.title: Combination therapy with fenofibrate, a peroxisome proliferator-activated receptor alpha agonist, and simvastatin, a 3-hydroxy-3-methylglutaryl-coenzyme A reductase inhibitor, on experimental traumatic brain injury.
results.text_hl: First, our dose-effect study demonstrated that the most efficient dose of @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ (37.5 mg/kg) reduced @<m>DISEASE_Epilepsy_Post_Traumatic</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D004834 @@@post-traumatic neurological deficits@@@ and @DISEASE_Brain_Edema @DISEASE_MESH:D001929 @@@brain edema@@@.

citations.NLM: Chen XR, Besson VC, Beziaud T, Plotkine M, Marchand-Leroux C. Combination therapy with fenofibrate, a peroxisome proliferator-activated receptor alpha agonist, and simvastatin, a 3-hydroxy-3-methylglutaryl-coenzyme A reductase inhibitor, on experimental traumatic brain injury. J Pharmacol Exp Ther. 2008 Sep;326(3):966-74. PMID: 18562561
citations.BibTeX: @article{18562561, title={Combination therapy with fenofibrate, a peroxisome proliferator-activated receptor alpha agonist, and simvastatin, a 3-hydroxy-3-methylglutaryl-coenzyme A reductase inhibitor, on experimental traumatic brain injury.}, author={Chen XR and Besson VC and Beziaud T and Plotkine M and Marchand-Leroux C}, journal={J Pharmacol Exp Ther}, volume={326}, number={3}, pages={966-74}}

results.title: Long-lasting benefits after treatment of traumatic brain injury (TBI) in rats with combination therapy of marrow stromal cells (MSCs) and simvastatin.
results.text_hl: Adult female Wistar @SPECIES_10116 @@@rats@@@ (n=72 and 8, per group) were injured with controlled @<m>DISEASE_Epilepsy_Post_Traumatic</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D004834 @@@cortical impact@@@ and treated either with monotherapy of MSCs or @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ or a combination therapy of these two agents.

citations.NLM: Mahmood A, Goussev A, Lu D, Qu C, Xiong Y, Kazmi H, Chopp M. Long-lasting benefits after treatment of traumatic brain injury (TBI) in rats with combination therapy of marrow stromal cells (MSCs) and simvastatin. J Neurotrauma. 2008 Dec;25(12):1441-7. PMID: 19072586
citations.BibTeX: @article{19072586, title={Long-lasting benefits after treatment of traumatic brain injury (TBI) in rats with combination therapy of marrow stromal cells (MSCs) and simvastatin.}, author={Mahmood A and Goussev A and Lu D and Qu C and Xiong Y and Kazmi H and Chopp M}, journal={J Neurotrauma}, volume={25}, number={12}, pages={1441-7}}

results.title: Simvastatin attenuates microglial cells and astrocyte activation and decreases interleukin-1beta level after traumatic brain injury.
results.text_hl: METHODS: Controlled @<m>DISEASE_Epilepsy_Post_Traumatic</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D004834 @@@cortical impact injury@@@ was performed in adult male Wistar @SPECIES_10116 @@@rats@@@.

citations.NLM: Li B, Mahmood A, Lu D, Wu H, Xiong Y, Qu C, Chopp M. Simvastatin attenuates microglial cells and astrocyte activation and decreases interleukin-1beta level after traumatic brain injury. Neurosurgery. 2009 Jul;65(1):179-85; discussion 185-6. PMID: 19574840
